meanings.definition: Present participle of jow: to strike or bump against something
meanings.sent1: She was jowing the door with her shoulder to try and open it.
meanings.sent2: The kids were jowing the ball back and forth during recess.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter kept jowing into tables as he rushed around the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The storm was jowing against the windows, making them rattle.
meanings.sent5: The boxer was jowing his opponent with powerful punches.

meanings.definition: Third person singular present of jow: to make a deep, low sound
meanings.sent1: He hears the old clock jowing in the hallway every night.
meanings.sent2: The distant thunder was jowing softly in the background.
meanings.sent3: The engine of the car started jowing loudly before finally turning over.
meanings.sent4: The wind was jowing through the trees, creating a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The kettle was jowing on the stove, signaling that the water was boiling.
